titleInfo.title: Photomontage of students and faculty, a dancer, the Mexican president's family, a beauty contest winner, motorcyclists, military men, a gatekeeper, a tea room director, a car, a war reenactment, an operator, European royalty, a shop owner, and an airplane. Nashville Banner, 1927 June 19.

mods.abstract: Photomontage of Webb School students and faculty, a French dance student, the Mexican First Lady and her daughter in California, a beauty contest winner in California, English motorcyclists, military men in California, a London gatekeeper blowing a horn, a New York tea room director, a car decorated with a photo of Charles Lindbergh, a war reenactment at Harvard University, a switchboard operator in New York, European royalty, a Parisian shop owner holding a lion, and a group of people surrounding Lindbergh's plane in Paris. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.

originInfo.publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS 3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/digitallibraryoftennessee/DLTN_XSLT. Metadata originally created in a locally modified version of Qualified Dublin Core using ContentDM (data dictionary available: https://wiki.lib.utk.edu/display/DPLA).
